doc.field: New York University Archives Photographic Slides Collection
New York University Archives Photographic Slides Collection

The New York University Archives Photographic Slides Collection was created by the University Archives to group together slides documenting New York University activities, schools and departments, staff, students, buildings, and classrooms. Materials in the collection date from 1900 to 2002, with the bulk of the slides dating from the 1970s to 2002.

The New York University Archives Photographic Slides Collection was created by the University Archives to group together slides documenting New York University activities, schools and departments, staff, students, buildings, and classrooms. Materials in the collection date from 1900 to 2002, with the bulk of the slides dating from the 1970s to 2002.
New York University. School of Education, Health, Nursing, and Arts Professions
New York University. School of Education, Health, Nursing, and Arts Professions
New York University. School of Education, Health, Nursing, and Arts Professions

The New York University Archives Photographic Slides Collection consists of binders of slides documenting various University activities, schools and departments, staff, students, buildings, and classrooms. Materials in the collection document the School of Education, Health, Nursing and Arts Professions; the College of Arts and Sciences; Tisch School of the Arts; Stern School of Business; and the School of Professional Studies. Materials in the collection date from 1900 to 2002, with the bulk of the slides dating from the 1970s to 2002.

The New York University Archives Photographic Slides Collection was created by the University Archives to group together slides documenting New York University activities, schools and departments, staff, students, buildings, and classrooms. Slides were transferred from university schools and departments, including School of Education, Health, Nursing and Arts Professions.

Some materials in this collection were transferred from various New York University departments in 1990 and 1992. No information was recorded about the acquisition of the other materials in this collection. The accession numbers associated with these transfers include 90.023 and 92.021.
